1.text: Select the correct statement relevant to the spread of TB

options.text: TB is a highly contagious, systemic disease.
Everyone exposed to the bacterium becomes infected and develop clinical symptoms.
options.feedback: Not everyone becomes infected when exposed to TB patients. It depends on the quantity of droplets nuclei in air and the length of exposure.

options.text: TB bacteria are spread through the droplet nuclei from one person to another by coughing, sneezing, shouting and singing.
TB is also spread by hand shake, sharing food or drink, touching bed linens or toilet seats, kissing.
options.feedback: TB does not spread by these means it spread through Air by coughing and sneezing when infected person does not cover his/her mouth during coughing and sneezing

2.text: Select the correct statement relevant to the pathogenesis of TB

options.text: When a person breathes in TB bacteria, the bacilli can settle in the lungs, begin to grow and multiply in the alveoli of lungs.
When a person breaths in TB bacilli, they kills the macrophages and spread into lungs within 2-3 days.
options.feedback: TB bacilli when entered into body, the macrophages ingest them and limit their further spread and multiplication.

options.text: TB spreads from the primary lung lesion to other parts of the body via the blood stream, lymphatic.
The chance of becoming infected has no relation with immunity of infected person.
options.feedback: The chance of becoming infected enhances when the person is immunocompromised like DM & HIV

options.text: Within 2 to 8 weeks,  macrophages ingest and surround the tubercle bacilli forming a granuloma
